It doesn\u2019t need     to be called by a DotVote (options get weird if it's not)     but for our use case the \u201cCREATE_ALLOCATION_ROLE\u201d will be given to     the DotVote. This function is public for stack-depth reasons","params":{"_accountId":"The Id of the budget used for the allocation","_amount":"The quantity of funds to be allocated","_candidateAddresses":"Array of potential addresses receiving a share of the allocation.","_description":"The distribution description","_period":"Time interval between each recurring allocation","_recurrences":"Quantity used to indicate whether this is a recurring or one-time payout","_supports":"The Array of all support values for the various candidates. attributes.type: function (struct Allocations.Payout storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

advancePeriod(uint64).details: This function is provided to circumvent situations where the transition period     becomes impossible to execute

params._limit: Maximum number of periods to advance in this execution

allowRecoverability(address).details: By default deriving from AragonApp makes it recoverable

params.token: Token address that would be recovered

allowRecoverability(address).return: bool whether the app allows the recovery

canPerform(address,bytes32,uint256[]).details: Check whether an action can be performed by a sender for a particular role on this app
canPerform(address,bytes32,uint256[]).return: Boolean indicating whether the sender has the permissions to perform the action.        Always returns false if the app hasn't been initialized yet.

params._accountId: The Id of the budget you'd like to take action against
params._candidateId: The Candidate whose allocation you'll execute (must be sender)
params._payoutId: The Id of the allocation within the budget you'd like to execute

params._accountId: The Id of the budget you'd like to take action against
params._candidateId: The Candidate whose allocation you'll execute (must be sender)
params._payoutId: The Id of the allocation within the budget you'd like to execute

params._accountId: The budget ID you'd like to get.

getCurrentPeriodId().details: We have to check for initialization as periods are only valid after initializing

getInitializationBlock().return: Block number in which the contract was initialized

params._payoutId: The Id of the allocation within the budget.
The ID of the allocation within the budget you'd like to retrieve.
The Id of the allocation within the budget.

params._idx: The Id of the specific recipient you'd like to retrieve information for.
params._payoutId: The Id of the allocation within the budget.

params._periodId: The Id of the period you'd like to receive information for.

getRecoveryVault().details: Get the recovery vault for the app
getRecoveryVault().return: Recovery vault address for the app

params._accountId: The account ID of the budget remaining to be calculated

hasInitialized().return: Whether the contract has been initialized by the time of the current block

initialize(address,uint64).details: On initialization the contract sets a vault, and initializes the periods     and accounts.

params._periodDuration: Base duration of a "period" used for value calculations.
params._vault: The Aragon vault to pull payments from.

newAccount(string,address,bool,uint256).details: This is the function that sets up a budget for creating allocations.

params._metadata: descriptor for account (pass in empty string if unchanged)

runPayout(uint64,uint64).details: This function distributes the allocations to the candidates in accordance with the distribution values

params._accountId: The Id of the budget you'd like to take action against
params._payoutId: The Id of the allocation within the budget you'd like to execute

params._metadata: descriptor for the account (pass in empty string if unchanged)

setDistribution(address[],uint256[],uint.details: This is the function that the DotVote will call. It doesn’t need     to be called by a DotVote (options get weird if it's not)     but for our use case the “CREATE_ALLOCATION_ROLE” will be given to     the DotVote. This function is public for stack-depth reasons

params._accountId: The Id of the budget used for the allocation
params._amount: The quantity of funds to be allocated
params._candidateAddresses: Array of potential addresses receiving a share of the allocation.
params._period: Time interval between each recurring allocation
params._recurrences: Quantity used to indicate whether this is a recurring or one-time payout
params._supports: The Array of all support values for the various candidates. These values are set in dot voting.

params._periodDuration: Duration in seconds for accounting periods

params._token: Token balance to be sent to recovery vault.

candidateExecutePayout(uint64,uint64,uin.notice: This transaction will execute the allocation for the senders address for budget #`_accountId`

executePayout(uint64,uint64,uint256).notice: This transaction will execute the allocation for candidate `_candidateId` within budget #`_accountId`

getNumberOfCandidates(uint64,uint64).notice: Basic getter for getting the number of options in an Allocation.

getPayoutDistributionValue(uint64,uint64.notice: Basic getter for Allocation value for a specific recipient.

getRemainingBudget(uint64).notice: get the account's remaining budget for the current period

removeBudget(uint64,string).notice: Remove budget #`_accountId`, effective immediately and optionally update budget name.

setBudget(uint64,uint256,string).notice: `_amount == 0 ? 'Deactivate ' + _metadata + ' budget (#' + _accountId + ')' : 'Update budget #' + _accountId + ' to ' + @tokenAmount(0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000, _amount, false) + ', effective immediately and optionally update metadata'`

setDistribution(address[],uint256[],uint.notice: Create an allocation from budget #`_accountId` for "`_description`" `(_recurrences > 1) ? 'that will execute ' + _recurrences + ' times': ''`.

setMaxCandidates(uint256).notice: Set the maximum number of candidates that can be paid out in an allocation to `_maxCandidates`.

setPeriodDuration(uint64).notice: Change period duration to `@transformTime(_periodDuration)`, effective for next accounting period

transferToVault(address).notice: Send funds to recovery Vault. This contract should never receive funds,        but in case it does, this function allows one to recover them.
